name: Museo Nacional de Artes Visuales
description: Uruguay's most important public museum of visual arts, with permanent and temporary exhibitions, located in Parque Rodó.
address: Tomás Giribaldi 2283 esq. Julio Herrera y Reissig, Parque Rodó, Montevideo, Uruguay

name: Teatro Solís
description: Historic main theatre in Montevideo offering guided tours and a variety of cultural performances (opera, concerts, theater).
address: Reconquista S/N, corner Bartolomé Mitre, Ciudad Vieja, Montevideo, Uruguay

name: Fortaleza del Cerro (Fortaleza General Artigas)
description: Hilltop fortress overlooking Montevideo Bay, with a military museum and panoramic views of the city and river.
address: Av. José Batlle y Ordóñez S/N, Cerro, Montevideo, Uruguay

name: Museo de Artes Decorativas (Palacio Taranco)
description: Elegant historic mansion turned museum, exhibiting decorative arts, period furniture, and domestic life of early 20th century Uruguay.
address: 25 de Mayo 376, corner Solís, Ciudad Vieja, Montevideo, Uruguay

name: Mercado del Puerto
description: Famous gastronomic market in Ciudad Vieja with parrillas, food stalls, lively atmosphere, ideal to try Uruguayan asado and local cuisine.
address: Piedras 237 (Pérez Castellano), Ciudad Vieja, Montevideo, Uruguay
cost: Free (entry free; you pay for food/drinks)

name: Plaza Independencia (Mausoleum of Artigas)
description: Montevideo's principal square; contains the statue and mausoleum of José Artigas, and is surrounded by key landmarks.

name: Playa Pocitos
description: One of Montevideo's most visited urban beaches, with a long promenade ideal for walking, relaxing, and enjoying city views by the Río de la Plata.

name: Ciudad Vieja (Old Town)
description: Historic old quarter of Montevideo: pedestrian streets, colonial architecture, galleries, cafes, the Puerta de la Ciudadela and local art scenes.
cost: Free to walk around (museums/shops inside may charge)
